General

  • delcookie - Delete cookie

  • parse_dsn - Parse DSN string

  • timetoarray - Time to array

  • xml_encode - Returns the XML representation of a array

delcookie(string $name, string $path = '', string $domain = '')

Delete cookie

Defines a cookie to be sent along with the rest of the HTTP headers with an expiration time in the past therefor telling the browser the cookie has expired.

Parameters

  • $name (string) – The name of the cookie.

  • $path (string) – The path on the server in which the cookie will be delete for. The default value is the current directory that the cookie is being deleted in.

  • $domain (string) – The (sub)domain that the cookie will be deleted for.

Example 34 Delete cookie
1<?php
2
3if ($clear_search) {
4  delcookie('search_text');
5}
6
7?>

Back to list

parse_dsn(string $dsn)

Parse DSN string

This function will parse a given Data Source Name (DSN) string and return an associated array of its contents.

Parameters

  • $dsn (string) – Data Source Name (DSN) string to parse

Returns

array Returns DSN elements as associated array.

See also

PHP PDO Drivers list.

Example 35 Get dsn parts
 1<?php
 2
 3$dsn_str = 'mysql:host=localhost;dbname=my_database;charset=utf8mb4';
 4$dsn_arr = parse_dsn($dsn_str);
 5echo $dsn_arr['driver'];  // mysql
 6echo $dsn_arr['host'];    // localhost
 7echo $dsn_arr['dbname'];  // my_database
 8echo $dsn_arr['charset']; // utf8mb4
 9
10?>

Back to list

timetoarray(int $time)

Time to array

Takes a provide time and returns an array of time units.

Parameters

  • $time (integer) – Time

Returns

array Array time

Example 36 Time to array
 1<?php
 2
 3var_dump(timetoarray(123456)); // [
 4                               //   'secs' => int 36
 5                               //   'mins' => float 17
 6                               //   'hrs'  => float 10
 7                               //   'days' => float 1
 8                               // ];
 9
10?>

Back to list

xml_encode(array $array, int $flags)

Returns the XML string representation of a array

Parameters

  • $array (array) – Array to be encoded as XML

Returns

string Returns a string containing the XML representation of the supplied array.

Example 37 Array to XML string
 1<?php
 2
 3$data = [
 4    'name'  => 'John Doe',
 5    'email' => 'john@domain.com',
 6];
 7
 8echo xml_encode($data); // <?xml version="1.0"?>
 9                        // <root><name>John Doe</name><email>john@domain.com</email></root>
10
11?>

Back to list
